rev.comment: it is unclear is the phone has been "discontinued": renaming section to "support"
rev.diff:
Line 196: Line 196:
* [[Goldman Sachs]] slashed their estimates for sales of the phone in 2010 by 70% due to the half-hearted marketing efforts by carriers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theregister.co.uk/2010/03/11/nexus_one_sales/|title=Carrier apathy depresses Google Phone outlook}}</ref>
* [[Goldman Sachs]] slashed their estimates for sales of the phone in 2010 by 70% due to the half-hearted marketing efforts by carriers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theregister.co.uk/2010/03/11/nexus_one_sales/|title=Carrier apathy depresses Google Phone outlook}}</ref>

=="Discontinuation"==
+
==Support==
On July 16, 2010, Google announced that the next shipment of Nexus One smartphones would be the last to be sold on their web store, stating "While the global adoption of the Android platform has exceeded our expectations, the web store has not. Itâs remained a niche channel for early adopters, but itâs clear that many customers like a hands-on experience before buying a phone."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2010/05/nexus-one-changes-in-availability.html |title=Nexus One changes in availability}}</ref> The device will continue to be sold through retail stores, and other channel partners.<ref>[http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2010/08/nexus-one-developer-phone.html Android Developers Blog: Nexus One Developer Phone<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2010/TECH/mobile/07/19/nexus.one.discontinued/index.html?iref=NS1#fbid=nPeDbHV_wpr |title=Google quietly kills its once-hyped Nexus One phone |first=Doug |last=Gross |publisher=[[CNN]] |date=July 19, 2010 |accessdate=August 8, 2010}}</ref>
On July 16, 2010, Google announced that the next shipment of Nexus One smartphones would be the last to be sold on their web store, stating "While the global adoption of the Android platform has exceeded our expectations, the web store has not. Itâs remained a niche channel for early adopters, but itâs clear that many customers like a hands-on experience before buying a phone."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2010/05/nexus-one-changes-in-availability.html |title=Nexus One changes in availability}}</ref> The device will continue to be sold through retail stores, and other channel partners.<ref>[http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2010/08/nexus-one-developer-phone.html Android Developers Blog: Nexus One Developer Phone<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2010/TECH/mobile/07/19/nexus.one.discontinued/index.html?iref=NS1#fbid=nPeDbHV_wpr |title=Google quietly kills its once-hyped Nexus One phone |first=Doug |last=Gross |publisher=[[CNN]] |date=July 19, 2010 |accessdate=August 8, 2010}}</ref>
